p: In 2019, world production of raspberries was 822.49 K metric tons (mt), with Russia as the leading producer, supplying 22.0% of the world total. Other major producers were Mexico (16.3%), Serbia (15.2%), United States (13%) and Poland (9.6%) [ 7]. Most of raspberries are used for processing juices, jams, wine, etc. [ 4]. During the processing a large amount of berry by-products (pomace, seeds, etc.) are produced. Raspberry seeds are considered as by-product or waste [ 8]. Oil from raspberries seeds is receiving increasing attention among scientists, farmers, processors and consumers. This kind of berry oils often have a unique fatty acid profiles and has interesting other minor bioactive components that are in demand on the market [ 9].
